subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks that a source file begins with a specified header. Property headerFile specifies a file that contains the required header. Alternatively, the header specification can be set directly in the header property without the need for an external file.

Property ignoreLines specifies the line numbers to ignore when matching lines in a header file. This property is very useful for supporting headers that contain copyright dates. For example, consider the following header:
Since the year information will change over time, you can tell Checkstyle to ignore line 4 by setting property ignoreLines to 4.

tr.td: name of the file containing the required header
the required header specified inline. Individual header lines must be separated by the string "\n" (even on platforms with a different line separator), see examples below.

subsection.name: Example
subsection.p: To configure the check to use header file "java.header" and ignore lines 2, 3, and 4:
To configure the check to verify that each file starts with the header
without the need for an external header file:
subsection.source: <module name="Header"> <property name="header" value="// Copyright (C) 2004 MyCompany\n// All rights reserved"/> </module>

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks the header of a source file against a header that contains a regular expression for each line of the source header.
Rationale: In some projects checking against a fixed header is not sufficient, e.g. the header might require a copyright line where the year information is not static.
For example, consider the following header:
subsection.source: line 1: ^/{71}$ line 2: ^// checkstyle:$ line 3: ^// Checks Java source code for adherence to a set of rules\.$ line 4: ^// Copyright \(C\) \d\d\d\d Oliver Burn$ line 5: ^// Last modification by \$Author.*\$$ line 6: ^/{71}$ line 7: line 8: ^package line 9: line 10: ^import line 11: line 12: ^/\*\* line 13: ^ \*([^/]|$) line 14: ^ \*/
subsection.p: Lines 1 and 6 demonstrate a more compact notation for 71 '/' characters. Line 4 enforces that the copyright notice includes a four digit year. Line 5 is an example how to enforce revision control keywords in a file header. Lines 12-14 is a template for javadoc (line 13 is so complecated to remove conflict with and of javadoc comment).

tr.td: name of the file containing the required header

the required header specified inline. Individual header lines must be separated by the string "\n" (even on platforms with a different line separator), and regular expressions must not span multiple lines.
line numbers to repeat (zero or more times)

subsection.name: Example
subsection.p: To configure the check to use header file "java.header" and 10 and 13 muli-lines:
To configure the check to verify that each file starts with the header
without the need for an external header file:
subsection.source: <module name="RegexpHeader"> <property name="header" value="^// Copyright \(C\) (\d\d\d\d -)? 2004 MyCompany$\n^// All rights reserved$"/> </module>
subsection.p: Note: ignoreLines property has been removed from this check to simplify it. To make some line optional use "^.*$" regexp for this line.
